text.section:
This section does not:
Apply to a food establishment that is required to have a license under § 21-305 of this subtitle; or
Exempt a cottage food business from any applicable State or federal tax laws.
A cottage food business is not required to be licensed by the Department if the owner of the cottage food business complies with this section.
The owner of a cottage food business shall comply with all applicable county and municipal laws and ordinances regulating the preparation, processing, storage, and sale of cottage food products.

section.section: The Department may investigate any complaint alleging that a cottage food business has violated this section.
On receipt of a complaint, a representative of the Department, at a reasonable time, may enter and inspect the premises of a cottage food business to determine compliance with this section.

The owner of a cottage food business may not:
Refuse to grant access to a representative who requests to enter and inspect the premises of the cottage food business under paragraph (2) of this subsection; or
Interfere with any inspection under paragraph (2) of this subsection.
An investigation of a cottage food business conducted under this subsection may include sampling of a cottage food product to determine if the cottage food product is misbranded or adulterated.

text.section: The Department shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
